attributes.action: Equalise per capita expenditure by region, eliminating the present subsidy of London by the English regions
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The Public expenditure Statistical Analysis 2007 on the HM-Treasury Website shows that the Government spends £8,200 per inhabitant in London, compared with £5,995 per inhabitant in Eastern England and £6,334 per inhabitant in the East Midlands. Equalising this would ease unemployment in the regions and also alleviate many problems in London caused by the increased population as the high Government spending there draws more and more people to London.

rejection.details: These figures do not necessarily mean there is a "subsidy" as you suggest - taxes paid per capita must also be taken into consideration.
reasons: Potentially libellous, false, or defamatory statements
